Definition: An aggregation of items. The term collection means that the resource is described as a group, its parts may be separately described and navigated.

a body of data of one kind (text or audio) that can be accessed and analysed as a whole, usually via a corpus search system; corpus is in general not synonymous or narrower of a collection, because the individual items may not be accessible separately.
list of structured items describing/defining various aspects of lexical units (words, multi-word expressions)
formalized description of the structure of a language
data, oftentimes numeric, in structured form (tabular), collected
additional/secondary structured information explicating certain aspects of the original resource. (Which could be of any type: text, audio, video, image, ...)
Resource whose content is primarily intended to be perceived acoustically.
Source: source: based on: DCMI, adapted: Durco

Definition: Resource consisting of a series of images  imparting an impression of motion when shown in succession, mostly accompanied by an synchronized audio signal, primarily intended to be perceived visually and acoustically.
Source: source: based on: DCMI, adapted: Durco

Definition: bundle of resources capturing different aspects of a recording, usually and audio or video file with a transcription and metadata describing the characterisits of the recording
A data processing resource, either available online, or executable on a local computer, either for human or machine interaction.
interactive resource meant for human interaction, available online, accessible via web browser
meant for machine interaction, available online, accessible via defined protocol
meant for human interaction, has to be executed on local computer, features a graphical user interface
software system that can be executed on local computer, without a graphical user interface
All persistent physical items with a relatively stable form, man-made or natural
